task_summary: Detect the T-block and goal, approach and align the circular tool, set yaw, perform two push cycles leftward, verify the block is at the goal outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a red T-shaped block on white background with a printed blue T outline marking the target pose. A UR-style arm with a circular end-effector must push the block until it overlaps the target outline. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception of both the block and goal, careful approach and yaw alignment, then one or more straight pushes. After motion, the system verifies final placement and safely retreats to clear the workspace. Observation and control operate at 10 Hz; timeouts are binned to conservative values.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-block and printed target outline.
Camera view covers the object and target area.
Robot is homed and free of collisions.
Friction sufficient for pushing without slipping excessively.
stepwise_plan: Move above and approach the block with tight alignment.
Set tool yaw to align push direction.
Execute two push cycles toward the goal.
Verify the block is at the target.
success_criteria: Block footprint overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance.
No loss of contact during pushing cycles.
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose.
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry perception up to 3 times.
If push is insufficient, the repeated push cycle provides additional travel.
If final location check fails, the tree can re-enter push (operator restart) or adjust yaw.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the block is verified at the target and the arm has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable tool–block contact with alignment about to be set
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected leftward toward the outline

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Approach and align tool to push face.
Verify block is at the target.

assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue target outline; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) differ. Used symbolic names 't_block' and 'target_zone'.
Push direction chosen as 180° (left) based on frames where tool approaches from the right.

expected_success_criteria: Block overlaps target outline after pushes
No collisions or tool lingering on contact
